title: How to Make Cheese Dip

steps.headline: Melt 3/4 tablespoon (10 g) of unsalted butter in a saucepan.
steps.description: Measure 3/4 tablespoon (10 g) of unsalted butter into a small saucepan. Place the saucepan on the cooktop at a medium heat. Gently stir the butter with a wooden spoon.

steps.headline: Mix 1 tablespoon (10 g) of white flour into the butter.
steps.description: Measure 1 tablespoon (10 g) of white flour and pour it into the melted four. Keep the saucepan over the heat and stir the mixture for 1 minute. If you notice the mixture sticking to the bottom of the saucepan, turn down the heat.

steps.headline: Stir0.5 cups (120 mL) milk gradually to the mixture.
steps.description: Add half the milk to the mixture and whisk it until it begins to thicken. Add the rest of the milk and stir the mixture for 2 minutes. If the consistency of the sauce is too thick, stir in an extra 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of milk to the mixture. If the mixture isn’t creamy yet, stir the mixture for another minute.

steps.headline: Add 3/4 cup (85 g) of grated cheese.
steps.description: Turn down the cooktop to low to avoid the mixture sticking to the pan. The heat of the mixture will melt the cheese. Continue to stir the mixture until all the cheese has melted and the sauce looks creamy. If the cheese isn’t melting, turn up the heat slightly.

steps.headline: Season the dip with salt and pepper if you desire.
steps.description: Taste the tip with a teaspoon. If you think it needs more flavour, add a pinch of salt and cayenne pepper. Taste the mixture again and keep adding small amounts of salt and pepper until you are happy with the taste. Be careful when tasting the dip as it will be hot.

steps.headline: Serve the dip with your favourite snacks or use it as a sauce.
steps.description: This creamy dip is a great addition to vegetable platters. Try dipping carrots, broccoli, or cucumber. Breadsticks, pretzels, chips, and crackers are other delicious dipping options. Alternatively, use the dip as a sauce for your dinner. It will compliment mashed potatoes, roasted vegetables, and sausages. Keep leftover dip in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 6 months. Smell the dip before you eat it. If the dip has a bad smell, throw it out. If you reheat the dip, mix it thoroughly before you eat it. This will help to restore its creamy consistency. Warm the dip on a medium heat on the stovetop.

steps.headline: Melt 2 tbsp (28.4 grams) of butter in a saucepan on a medium heat.
steps.description: Turn the stovetop onto a medium heat. Measure 2 tbsp (28.4 grams) of butter into a small saucepan and place it onto the heat. If the butter starts to boil, turn the heat down. Substitute the butter for margarine if you prefer.

steps.headline: Stir in 1 tsp (5 g) of salt and 2 tbsp (18 g) of flour into the butter.
steps.description: Leave the saucepan on the heat. Add the salt and flour once the butter has melted. Use a wooden spoon to mix the ingredients together. Continue to stir the mixture until the butter has completely absorbed the salt and flour and the mixture is gently simmering.

steps.headline: Mix 1 cup (240 mL) of milk into the mixture.
steps.description: Gently pour 1 cup (240 mL) of milk into the saucepan. Continue to stir the mixture until it begins to thicken. If the mixture starts to stick to the bottom of the saucepan, turn the heat down. High-fat fat milk will make a creamier dip but a low-fat milk will also work.

steps.headline: Stir in 1 c of (125 g) shredded cheddar cheese and 1 tsp (5 g) of prepared mustard.
steps.description: Add the cheese and mustard to the hot mixture. Keep stirring the dip until the cheese has completely melted and the mixture is smooth. If the cheese isn’t melting, turn up the heat.

steps.headline: Add salt and pepper if you desire.
steps.description: Dip a teaspoon into the mixture and taste the dip. Add a dash of salt and pepper if you think that the dip requires extra flavour. Taste the mixture again and continue to add salt and pepper until you are satisfied with the flavour.

steps.headline: Pour the dip into a serving dish.
steps.description: Cheese dip is best served warm so transfer it straight into a serving container. Carefully tip the saucepan and pour the dip into the serving dish. If the dip is thick, you may need to use a spatula to help remove the mixture from the saucepan. Choose a heat-proof serving dish as the dip will be hot.

steps.headline: Serve the dip with savoury snacks.
steps.description: Place the dip onto the table along with a plate of dipping foods. Chopped vegetables are a healthy and yummy option. Try celery, carrot, broccoli, or cucumber. Breadsticks, chips, and crackers are other delicious options. Use the cheese dip as part of a platter or serve it as a sauce for your dinner. It will compliment cauliflower, potato, and sausages.

steps.headline: Store leftover dip in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days.
steps.description: Place leftover dip into the fridge within 2 hours of making it. If you want to use the dip at a later date, place the airtight container into the freezer. Frozen dip can be stored for up to 6 months. If the dip has an unpleasant odour, throw it out. Stir the dip thoroughly if you reheat it. This will help it to regain an even consistency. Reheat the dip on a medium heat on the stovetop.

text: Creamy Cheese Dip Melt 3/4 tablespoon (10 g) of unsalted butter in a saucepan. Measure 3/4 tablespoon (10 g) of unsalted butter into a small saucepan. Place the saucepan on the cooktop at a medium heat. Gently stir the butter with a wooden spoon. Mix 1 tablespoon (10 g) of white flour into the butter. Measure 1 tablespoon (10 g) of white flour and pour it into the melted four. Keep the saucepan over the heat and stir the mixture for 1 minute. If you notice the mixture sticking to the bottom of the saucepan, turn down the heat. Stir0.5 cups (120 mL) milk gradually to the mixture. Add half the milk to the mixture and whisk it until it begins to thicken. Add the rest of the milk and stir the mixture for 2 minutes. If the consistency of the sauce is too thick, stir in an extra 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of milk to the mixture. If the mixture isn’t creamy yet, stir the mixture for another minute. Add 3/4 cup (85 g) of grated cheese. Turn down the cooktop to low to avoid the mixture sticking to the pan. The heat of the mixture will melt the cheese. Continue to stir the mixture until all the cheese has melted and the sauce looks creamy. If the cheese isn’t melting, turn up the heat slightly. Season the dip with salt and pepper if you desire. Taste the tip with a teaspoon. If you think it needs more flavour, add a pinch of salt and cayenne pepper. Taste the mixture again and keep adding small amounts of salt and pepper until you are happy with the taste. Be careful when tasting the dip as it will be hot. Serve the dip with your favourite snacks or use it as a sauce. This creamy dip is a great addition to vegetable platters. Try dipping carrots, broccoli, or cucumber. Breadsticks, pretzels, chips, and crackers are other delicious dipping options. Alternatively, use the dip as a sauce for your dinner. It will compliment mashed potatoes, roasted vegetables, and sausages. Keep leftover dip in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days or in the freezer for up to 6 months. Smell the dip before you eat it. If the dip has a bad smell, throw it out. If you reheat the dip, mix it thoroughly before you eat it. This will help to restore its creamy consistency. Warm the dip on a medium heat on the stovetop. Cheese and Mustard Dip Melt 2 tbsp (28.4 grams) of butter in a saucepan on a medium heat. Turn the stovetop onto a medium heat. Measure 2 tbsp (28.4 grams) of butter into a small saucepan and place it onto the heat. If the butter starts to boil, turn the heat down. Substitute the butter for margarine if you prefer. Stir in 1 tsp (5 g) of salt and 2 tbsp (18 g) of flour into the butter. Leave the saucepan on the heat. Add the salt and flour once the butter has melted. Use a wooden spoon to mix the ingredients together. Continue to stir the mixture until the butter has completely absorbed the salt and flour and the mixture is gently simmering. Mix 1 cup (240 mL) of milk into the mixture. Gently pour 1 cup (240 mL) of milk into the saucepan. Continue to stir the mixture until it begins to thicken. If the mixture starts to stick to the bottom of the saucepan, turn the heat down. High-fat fat milk will make a creamier dip but a low-fat milk will also work. Stir in 1 c of (125 g) shredded cheddar cheese and 1 tsp (5 g) of prepared mustard. Add the cheese and mustard to the hot mixture. Keep stirring the dip until the cheese has completely melted and the mixture is smooth. If the cheese isn’t melting, turn up the heat. Add salt and pepper if you desire. Dip a teaspoon into the mixture and taste the dip. Add a dash of salt and pepper if you think that the dip requires extra flavour. Taste the mixture again and continue to add salt and pepper until you are satisfied with the flavour. Pour the dip into a serving dish. Cheese dip is best served warm so transfer it straight into a serving container. Carefully tip the saucepan and pour the dip into the serving dish. If the dip is thick, you may need to use a spatula to help remove the mixture from the saucepan. Choose a heat-proof serving dish as the dip will be hot. Serve the dip with savoury snacks. Place the dip onto the table along with a plate of dipping foods. Chopped vegetables are a healthy and yummy option. Try celery, carrot, broccoli, or cucumber. Breadsticks, chips, and crackers are other delicious options. Use the cheese dip as part of a platter or serve it as a sauce for your dinner. It will compliment cauliflower, potato, and sausages. Store leftover dip in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 4 days. Place leftover dip into the fridge within 2 hours of making it. If you want to use the dip at a later date, place the airtight container into the freezer. Frozen dip can be stored for up to 6 months. If the dip has an unpleasant odour, throw it out. Stir the dip thoroughly if you reheat it. This will help it to regain an even consistency. Reheat the dip on a medium heat on the stovetop.
